message.content:
{"id": "12906", "title": "Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Cannot open file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor (should display error message)", "description": "Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)", "OB": "When a file is opened in one editor, if another attempt is made to open the same file in a different editor, the file is successfully opened in the second editor without any error message.", "EB": "When a file is already opened in one editor, attempting to open the same file in another editor should trigger a warning message stating that there are unsaved changes and asking if the user wants to continue, or an error message indicating that the file needs to be closed before opening it in another editor.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Ensure that a Java file is associated with a Windows editor.
2. Open the Java Perspective.
3. Double click on a Java file to open it in the workbench.
4. Right click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor' - a notepad or wordpad window will open with the Java file.
5. Close the notepad or wordpad window.
6. Double click on the Java file to open it again in the workbench.
7. Right click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.

Expected behavior: A warning message should be displayed informing the user that there are unsaved changes and asking if they want to continue, or an error message should be displayed indicating that the file needs to be closed before opening it in another editor.

This behavior is likely a safety feature in which the IDE doesn't allow external editing while the file is already opened in the IDE."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '12906', 'title': 'Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)', 'description': 'Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg) ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': "Make sure you have an assoicate Windows editor for your java file.Ifnot, go to the file explorer, double click on any java file, and selectWordPad or notepadas default editor for all java files.In the Java Perspective, right click on the Java fileOpen With ..System Editor.A notepad and wordpad window will pop up with the javafile opened. Close it.go to the Java Perspective, open a java file by simply double clickingon it.The file is now opened in the workbench.Now right click on the Java fileOpen With .. System Editor.Nothing happens.The workbench should be warning message saying thatyou may overwrite changes... and do you want to continue?or errormessage saying that theh should close all file first.We believe it's a safety feature where WSAD doesn't allow externalediting while the file is already opened in WSAD. "}
